transcripts.text: I'm here outside the Joe Biden Town Hall in New Hampshire, where a lot of supporters and frankly, people who are just curious about him are lining up outside.  And my observation is, is that this is overwhelmingly an older crowd, much more than the other town halls and campaign events that I've been to.  Quite simply, why do you support Joe Biden?
I think he has the most experience.  I'm hopeful that he has the best chance to win against Trump.  And I think that that is all the case.  So I'm looking forward to him to be the president.
Why do you think he has the best chance to defeat Donald Trump?

Is it safe to say you're a Joe Biden supporter or you're just more curious about him as a candidate right now?  I am a Joe Biden supporter.  I just need to... I just need to... you know, see more.  Would you define yourself as a Joe Biden supporter?  No.
I define myself as a registered independent who will make up her mind come November.

I would say I'm fairly independent and decided at this point.  I am a registered independent, but I tend to lean Democrat.  We're this fall making a goal to see all the major candidates so that we can make up our mind.

What's different from, say, a Bernie Sanders town hall or an Elizabeth Warren town hall, which I've attended, is that those people are hardcore supporters of that candidate.  A lot of the New Hampshire residents I spoke to who are coming into this town hall are still undecided and are just interested in Joe Biden.

My father used to say that the greatest sin, and I mean this sincerely, the greatest sin one can commit is the abuse of power, whether it's political, economic, or physical.  When you say the cardinal sin, and I mean this from the bottom of my heart, the cardinal sin was for a man to raise his hand to a woman or a child.

Joe Biden is just wrapping up his New Hampshire town hall where he spoke for around 30 minutes off of a teleprompter, which is fine, but he didn't talk about any specific policy proposals for the future.  Now, he talked a lot about the Violence Against Women Act, his past policy victories there.  He talked about values.  He talked about Charlottesville.  He talked about Obama, about how Trump was terrible and all of those things.  But once again, no policy proposals for the future.  What did you think about Joe Biden's town hall today?

I like Joe Biden, but I thought the speech was very uninspiring.  I think that Trump was, he's going to kill him.  I'm sorry, but there's no way.  I mean, you got, you know, he's not telling anything new, any programs.
Yeah, I think he talked more about his values and his personal philosophy of things than some of the other candidates that have been coming in and talking a lot about their policies.
I think right now what we need is to embrace the values that we're all about.  I think that the policies will come.  And I think he has shown a policy orientation in the past that is strong.

If you're looking for problems, you can find it.  No, no, he's fine.  He's fine.  Unless one's goal is to tear him down.  The meme out there is, oh, he made a slip of the tongue.  Donald Trump makes slips of the tongue constantly.
Yeah, it's the lowest standard imaginable.

I think Warren, you know, she's got a lot of interesting things as well.  She's very well educated, and I think that she speaks about issues.  Listen, I love Joe Biden, but I don't want to hear that his daughter was a... A social worker.  That's great.  It's great that she was.  It's great that his wife has got two doctorate degrees and four master's degrees and still teaches.  That's all great.  But, you know, you got to inspire people.
